title: Ticket #1622: StatInfo::GetOwner() for a non-existent file should return 0
description:
StatInfo::GetOwner() returns an uninitialized value for a non-existent file. To match other StatInfo methods such as GetAccessTime(), GetModifyTime(), GetCreateTime(), and GetMode() it should return 0.

The unit test output: 
TEST:  Test that GetOwner() returns 0 for a file that doesn't exist.
INPUT:
    Directory Path:  DoesNotExist
    File Name:  DoesNotExist
EXPECTED OUTPUT:
    RETURN:  0
ACTUAL OUTPUT:
    RETURN:  135234261
RESULT:  FAILURE, test failed at line 1674 (0.000032 seconds)
In StatInfo::init() owner should be initialized to 0 or perhaps -1.
remarks:
2010-Aug-26 16:22:21 by psilord:
I'd be very careful with this one.... A uid of 0 means root!
check_ins: 2010-Sep-02 10:01   Check-in [18918]: Updated StatInfo::GetOwner() to EXCEPT if the owner is undefined. #1622 (By Josh Slauson )
creator: slauson
